name: solubility
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being able to be dissolved, or the degree to which something can be dissolved: Sugar has a high solubility in water, whereas gold has a low solubility in water. The solubility of a particular solid in water can be measured over a range of temperatures. See
soluble
More examplesFewer examplesThe substances separate according to their solubility in the solvent.The high water solubility of the chemical makes it a threat to drinking water.This anaesthetic differs from its predecessors in having lower solubility in blood and tissues.
